Issues.Title: ng_package only marks main @angular packages as external
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report

### Affected Package
`@angular/bazel`

### Description
Currently `ng_package` [hardcodes a list](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/8.0.0-beta.5/packages/bazel/src/ng_package/ng_package.bzl#L61-L95) of external packages to not include in the package being built. This list is a little arbitrary making it hard to tell when this must be done manually or if `ng_package` does it for you etc. It should probably either do nothing or be replaced with something more generic such as anything in `node_modules` or `dependencies` from `package.json`.

The error message is also quite cryptic and appears to be very angular/component specific. For example when depending on `@angular/material/x` I got an error about an ngfactory file file missing from an indirect dependency:
```
[!] (Plugin at position 3 plugin) Error: Could not resolve import '@angular/cdk/scrolling/virtual-scroll-viewport.ngfactory' from '...long tmp dir path.../bazel-out/darwin-fastbuild/bin/libs/butterfly/npm.es6/external/angular_material/src/cdk/overlay/overlay-container.js'
```

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction
A basic repro showing the issue when depending on material: https://github.com/jbedard/ng_package-material, running `bazel build //ui:npm` produces the error.

In this case it can be fixed quite easily by just adding:
```
   globals = {
       '@angular/material/button': 'ng.material.button',
       '@angular/material/icon': 'ng.material.icon',
   }
```
But that doesn't seem obvious based on the error message, and isn't clear why this one is required but something such as `@angular/animations` is not required.

Issues.Title: Normalize arrays
Issues.Body:
refactor(ivy): moved wrapped reference to 0 position in array 

`LView`, `LContainer`, `StylingContext` are all arrays which wrap either
an `HTMLElement`, `LView`, `LContainer`, `StylingContext`. It is often
necessary to retrieve the correct type of element from the location
which means that we often have to wrap the arrays. Logically it makes
more sense if the thing  which we are wrapping is at `0` location. Also
it may be more performant since data is more local which may result in
more L2 cache hits in CPU.



refactor(ivy): simplify differentiation of LView, `RNode`, `LView`, `LContainer`, `StylingContext`

For efficiency reasons we often put several different data types (`RNode`, `LView`, `LContainer`,
`StylingContext`) in same location in `LView`. This is because we don't want to pre-allocate
space
for it because the storage is sparse. This file contains utilities for dealing with such data
types.
How do we know what is stored at a given location in `LView`.
- `Array.isArray(value) === false` => `RNode` (The normal storage value)
- `Array.isArray(value) === true` => than the `value[0]` represents the wrapped value.
  - `typeof value[TYPE] === 'object'` => `LView`
     - This happens when we have a component at a given location
  - `typeof value[TYPE] === 'number'` => `StylingContext`
     - This happens when we have style/class binding at a given location.
  - `typeof value[TYPE] === true` => `LContainer`
     - This happens when we have `LContainer` binding at a given location.
NOTE: it is assumed that `Array.isArray` and `typeof` operations are very efficient.

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): process property bindings in i18n blocks similar to non-i18n bindings
Issues.Body:
Prior to this change i18n block bindings were converted to Expressions right away (once we first access them), when in non-i18n cases we processed them differently: the actual conversion happens at instructions generation. Because of this discrepancy, the output for bindings in i18n blocks was generated incorrectly (with invalid indicies in pipeBindN fns and invalid references to non-existent local variables). Now the bindings processing is unified and i18nExp instructions should contain right bind expressions.

This PR resolves FW-1101.

This change contains conditionally attached classes which provide human readable (debug) level
information for `LView`, `LContainer` and other internal data structures. These data structures
are stored internally as array which makes it very difficult during debugging to reason about the
current state of the system.

Patching the array with extra property does change the array's hidden class' but it does not
change the cost of access, therefore this patching should not have significant if any impact in

So instead of seeing:

Array(30) [Object, 659, null, ‚Ä¶]

Issues.Title: Export formatDateTime from @angular/common
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
@angular/common

### Description
The builtin DatePipe has twelve predefined formatting options. Six of those options include seconds, four of them also include the timezone.

Predefined formats w/ seconds: `medium`, `long`, `full`, `mediumTime`, `longTime`, `fullTime`
Predefined formats w/ timezone: `long`, `full`, `longTime`, `fullTime`

These seconds are not relevant to the end user of our/most applications. The timezone is also very rarely relevant. I'd like to have flexible date formatting without second or timezone information.

Using a custom format is not viable since I have to localise the website in many languages.

### Describe the solution you'd like
I'd like to use the formatDateTime function from @angular/common to construct my own date. Right now that is a private method. I'd like to have it exported from @angular/common so I can use it in my library.

I need that function to convert my custom date format to a CDLR compatible format.

**My config:**
```typescript
{
        date: FormatWidth.Full,
        time: FormatWidth.Short,
        separator: FormatWidth.Full,
}
```

**My output**
`Monday, June 15, 2015 at 9:03 AM` (no seconds and timezone information here)

I am already using three other functions from @angular/common to achieve this:
- getLocaleDateFormat
- getLocaleTimeFormat
- getLocaleDateTimeFormat

It's just that I had to copy `formatDateTime` function into my own source code. And I'd like to use the same one as Angular uses internally.

### Describe alternatives you've considered
I tried creating my own custom format. But I have to support more then 200 languages so I gave up.

```

### Description

My application has a couple of settings that are perfectly secure within the context of their use, but which produce (certainly helpful) warnings.  I've configured my app this way intentionally, and I don't want to see these warnings every time I start my application for development.

Here is my command:

    ng serve --host 0.0.0.0 --port 8000 --ssl true --ssl-key localhost.key --ssl-cert localhost.cert

And the warnings:

```
WARNING: This is a simple server for use in testing or debugging Angular applications
locally. It hasn't been reviewed for security issues.

Binding this server to an open connection can result in compromising your application or
computer. Using a different host than the one passed to the "--host" flag might result in
websocket connection issues. You might need to use "--disableHostCheck" if that's the
case.
```

The top one is useful, but I don't need to be reminded, I'm already not using Angular CLI in production.

The second one is of course useful as well, but I'm running this app inside of a Docker container on my dev machine with an port exposed to the host, so that's not an issue in my case either.

### Describe the solution you'd like
A broad flag (or a number of more specific flags) to disable warnings at start time.  I have found another issue requesting something like this here:

https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/11802

However, the answer given to this is to redirect stderr.  This does have the desired effect, but it _also_ disables all compile-time errors, which I _need_ for the development process.

### Describe alternatives you've considered
Either find a configuration that Angular complains about less, or simply ignore the warnings.

Issues.Title: Refactor RxJS code to not explicitly set generics
Issues.Body:
There are several instances in material where we are setting the generic type of an RxJS function explicitly in order to get a desired outcome. It would be better to cast instead. (Ideally, you don't have to do either, so what I'm talking about here is when you *must* do something explicit to get the return type to be correct)

For example:

```ts
defer<Foo>(() => someObservable)
```

should be:

```ts
defer(() => someObservable) as Observable<Foo>
```
This is because RxJS changes how generics are ordered for some functions between version 6.3 and 6.4.

It may even be worth testing these changes against updating to 6.4.

Issues.Body:

import (e.g. `@ngCore.NgModule`), the Material schematics will incorrectly not detect

is flawed.

accessed property name is exposed at the root level `PropertyAccessExpression`.

This PR fixes this and also adds additional unit tests for the `hasNgModuleImport`
utility function. (We have integration tests for this; but we don't test that special case)

Issues.Title: cdk-virtual-scroll-viewport error on server side rendering
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
Server side render version should work as expected.

#### What is the current behavior?
Error in server:

ReferenceError: requestAnimationFrame is not defined

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
SSR can't be reproduced on StackBlitz.

Browser: Chrome (not important)

#### Is there anything else we should know?
I've trace the error to virtual-scroll-viewport.ts ngOnInit method:

```ts
this.ngZone.runOutsideAngular(() => Promise.resolve().then(() => {
      this._measureViewportSize();
      this._scrollStrategy.attach(this);

      this.elementScrolled()
          .pipe(
              // Start off with a fake scroll event so we properly detect our initial position.
              startWith<Event | null>(null!),
              // Collect multiple events into one until the next animation frame. This way if
              // there are multiple scroll events in the same frame we only need to recheck
              // our layout once.
              auditTime(0, animationFrameScheduler))
          .subscribe(() => this._scrollStrategy.onContentScrolled());

      this._markChangeDetectionNeeded();
    }));
```

The line:

```ts
 auditTime(0, animationFrameScheduler))
```
is using the animation frame scheduler which is not available in ssr.

I guess that code should be only executed in browser.

Issues.Title: Mat-progress-bar should gradually appear and disappear, as per material.io spec
Issues.Body:
#### Please describe the feature you would like to request.
The material.io design spec for [progress indicators](https://material.io/design/components/progress-indicators.html#) has an ingenious solution to the problem of showing a progress bar that only appears for a fraction of a second. ([video](https://storage.googleapis.com/spec-host-backup/mio-design%2Fassets%2F1sSySgWKCC1qeSfWkBvSfI6X2CFnkpa2u%2F01-progress-intro.mp4))

**Spec:**
* When the progress indicator appears the height animates in from 0, so it gracefully appears without jumping. 
* When it disappears it animates height back to 0. 

Therefore a progress bar that is shown for only a few milliseconds may only reach a height of 1 or 2 pixels and be barely noticed. This is especially important when the progress bar represents a frequent operation with an unknown duration.

This behavior would not apply to all progress bar modes. Either a new mode `inactive` could be added, or an additional boolean value. 

`mode="(isBusy$ | async) ? 'indeterminate' : 'inactive'"`
`mode="indeterminate" isBusy="isBusy$ | async`

#### What is the use-case or motivation for this proposal?
It's in the spec, and it's very simple yet elegant way to solve the problem of something appearing and disappearing [suddenly](https://github.com/angular/material2/issues/8085). 

The spec shows exactly how a progress bar should work :-)

#### Is there anything else we should know?
Please don't suggest I make my own animation. This should be supported by the control.
